h3. Summary
When user open a new ticket using detailed view page after scrolling down the previous issue , the new open ticket will not displayed from the top of the ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Issue > Search Issues*
# Change the view to *Detail view*.
# Browse an issue from the right side. For example browsing issue TEST-51:-
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-20 at 10.00.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then , scroll down the issue :-
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-20 at 10.01.01 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Now , click a new ticket , for example TEST-48 :-
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-20 at 10.02.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Issue will display from the top.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is not displayed from the top.
fields.summary: Open new issue using Detail View , will not display from the top

Problem:

Comment field's Wiki Style renderer is not consistent. If there's a file attached on the issue, the Attachment button is available. However, when there's no attachment, the Wiki Style renderer will not show the Attachment button.


Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a Screen and associate it to a transition
# Transition an issue and observe the screens that will pop up
# If there's an existing file attached on the issue before transitioning the ticket, the Attachment button in the Comment field's Wiki Style renderer is there.
# If no attachment is uploaded on the issue prior to transitioning the issue, the button is missing.


Expected behaviour:
The attachment button in the Wiki Style Renderer should be consistently present regardless of a file is attached on the issue or not. 


Actual Behaviour:
It seems that the appearance of the Attachment button in the Wiki Style Renderer of Comment field depends on the presence/absence of a file in the ticket
fields.summary: Attachment link on the Wiki Style Rendered is  Missing

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

There are several third party add-ons that solve many of the use cases mentioned below:
* [Profields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.deiser.jira.profields]
* [JIRA Metadata Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.osoboo.jira-metadata-plugin]
* [JIRA Project Specific Select Field|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira.plugin.projectspecificselectfield.jpssf].

Please note that these add-ons are for Server only at this stage. We're looking to improve our JIRA Connect capabilities in the future to enable developers to provide this kind of capacity to Cloud customers, but there are no concrete dates at this stage for the release of these capabilities.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

h3. Summary
Even though Nested Groups is disabled for the external directory configuration, the users in nested groups get counted towards the license

h3. Environment
* Reproducible using Open LDAP
* Issue is reported to have occured also in AD


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link to an External Directory 
# Make sure you have not ticked option to enable nested groups
# Create nested group in the external directory
# Place some users in this nested group
# Sync to JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Users in nested group will not get counted towards the license

h3. Actual Results
Nested users get counted towards the license

h3.Workaround
* Remove users from the nested groups
OR 
* remove the nested group completely
fields.summary: Even though Nested Groups is disabled for the external directory configuration, the users in nested groups get counted towards the license

h3. Summary

Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 1000.695.1 (Cloud), JIRA 7.3.0 (Server)
 * Chrome 55.0.2883.95
 * macOS Sierra

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario1
 # Copy a PDF file in Finder.app
 # Open a JIRA issue in edit mode
 # Press {{Cmd + V}} in the editor

h4. Scenario2
 # Open Terminal.app
 # Execute the following commands
{code:java}
$ defaults write com.apple.screencapture type pdf
$ killall SystemUIServer
{code}

 # Press {{Command + Control + Shift + 3}} to capture a screenshot into the clipboard
 # Open a JIRA issue in edit mode
 # Press {{Cmd + V}} in the editor

h3. Expected Results

The paste from the clipboard should work correctly in the both scenario.
h3. Actual Results
h4. Scenario1

The PDF wasn't attached to the page and the filename is just pasted as a text.
h4. Scenario2

The paste failed silently.
 If we monitor the step in developer tools, we can see the following JavaScript error.
{code:java}
batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9238 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'slice' of undefined
    at Object.b.convertBlobToImage (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9238)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at new D (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at G (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at a (batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286)
    at batch.js?acjsFiveVersionEnabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-n…:9286
    at dispatch (batch.js?locale=ja-JP:120)
    at h (batch.js?locale=ja-JP:112)
{code}
When it comes to some of third-party apps, they try to store images as PDF when copying them into clipboard.
 That's why these scenario should be also considered.
h3. Notes

This problem might be caused by [this browser's spec|https://w3c.github.io/clipboard-apis/#reading-from-clipboard].
 Even though we don't support pasting PDF from clipboard, it would be more user friendly if JIRA could show some error on the UI.
h3. Workaround

Use the other browsers instead.
fields.summary: Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work

h3. Problem

The URL display in connecting to Oracle page was like this:
{code:java}
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle10g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@//domain-name:1521:ORCL</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jirauser</username>
    <password>jirauser</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <validation-query>select 1 from dual</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
    <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>{code}

But, the actual URL parameter display in {{dbconfig.xml}} is this:
{code}
<url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@//domain-name:1521/ORCL</url>
{code}

As you can see, "/" are the correct one instead of ":".

*Update the page:*
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+Oracle

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/connecting-jira-to-oracle-720411753.html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63795].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The Base URL Health Check in JIRA makes an HTTP request to the base URL. However, in some scenarios, the request will get caught in a circular reference to itself due to redirects in the SSO and SAML configuration.

The following appears in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{code:java}
2017-01-02 14:15:57,020 SupportHealthCheckThread-4 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.healthcheck.support.BaseUrlHealthCheck] An error occurred when performing the Base URL healthcheck: 
org.apache.http.client.ClientProtocolException
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:186)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:107)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.BaseUrlHealthCheck.doCheck(BaseUrlHealthCheck.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.support.AbstractSupportHealthCheck.check(AbstractSupportHealthCheck.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.impl.PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.check(PluginSuppliedSupportHealthCheck.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.thread.HealthCheckCallable.call(HealthCheckCallable.java:15)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.apache.http.client.CircularRedirectException: Circular redirect to 'base-url/jira'
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRedirectStrategy.getLocationURI(DefaultRedirectStrategy.java:176)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRedirectStrategy.getRedirect(DefaultRedirectStrategy.java:220)
	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:121)
	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:184)
	... 12 more
{code}

h5. Environment:
 * JIRA, listening on a context path of {{https://base-url/jira/}}
 * A SAML/SSO product responding to {{https://base-url/saml/}}

h5.Diagnosis
Performing a cURL to the base URL shows a redirect loop (extraneous headers stripped for clarity):
{code:java}
% curl -I -L https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira

HTTP/1.1 302 Found
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Server: Apache
Location: https://base-url/saml

HTTP/1.1 302 Moved Temporarily
Cache-Control: private
Date: Mon, 09 Jan 2017 08:52:28 GMT
Location: https://base-url/jira
{code}
In the scenario this issue is derived from, the customer had whitelisted calls to the REST API to not go through the SAML/SSO configuration. This means that while gadgets worked correctly, the Health Check failed due to the circular reference.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the check to query the gadget spec URL instead of the base URL, and rename it appropriately.

Alternatively for customers who are not able to make the modifications to exclude all requests from JIRA, it'd be great to either allow or just test an extra URL, either in addition to or instead of the current URL for testing which is the base URL.

Being able to detect circular redirects or too many redirects would also be a really good improvement to this health check.

h3. Workaround
For customers who do not wish to see or be alerted by the failing health check, you can take the following steps:
 # Go to Manage Add-ons
 # Select All add-ons and search for "Instance Health Plugin"
 # Expand the plugin and then expand the modules
 # Disable {{jira.healthcheck.baseurl.name}}
fields.summary: The JIRA Base URL Healthcheck can fail in certain SSO/SAML scenarios despite the gadgets URL working correctly

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63778].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
- In the documentation and on the description for this report, it says "For a date field and project or filter, maps the issues against the date that the field was set."
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/reporting-764478415.html
- This is incorrect, it's semantics but it very much changes the meaning. The report is based on the date selected in the field. The current language means the date that the field was changed.
- Let's say that today, 14/Dec/16 I set a field to 09/Jan/17, "the date that the field was set" is 14/Dec/16. The report uses the value of the field, 09/Jan/17.

h3. Suggestion
Change the description:
"For a date field and project or filter, maps the issues against the date that the field was set to" or "...the date set in the field".

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Change the description of the Time Since Issues Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63777].
  {panel}

JIRA Permission Scheme exposes a Browse Project permission which should deny access to the project listing to anyone.

It is a valid configuration having a JIRA Admin who will be able to Create Projects although not have Browse Project permissions.

The "Create Project with Shared Configuration" feature exposes a Project dropdown which lists all the existing projects in the instance, without honor the Browse Project permissions.

Steps to reproduce:

Logged as admin:
 * Create user "foo" in the administrator group (therefore it will have Create Project permissions)
 * Create a "bar" project using Default Permission Scheme
 * In Administration/Permission Schemes, remove administrator group from Browse Projects permission

Logged as foo:
 * Navigate to "Projects"/"View All Projects", you won't be able to visualize "bar" project (correct behavior)
Hit "Projects"/"Create project"
 * Click on the bottom link "Create with shared configuration"
 * In the "Choose a project" dropdown, you'll be able to list the "bar" project (unexpected behavior)
fields.summary: JIRA "Create Project with Shared Configuration" exposes list of projects to admins who don't have Browse Project permissions
Should be able to sort workflow status by project workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63775].
  {panel}

Need to be able to use a filter to identify a collection of open (status) bugs, then create a historical/chronological report that shows the volume of open bugs (e.g. a line chart) per day/week/month over that history. Note that "open" doesn't mean "opened" (as in the verb) but, rather, the status of open.

A couple of suggestions, that do NOT address this, I've seen via web search are:

1) Created vs Resolved Gadget - Shows the cases that are "opened" (open as a verb, not open as a status). Need the 'open status bugs' chronologically.

2) GreenHopper plugin - Shows opened vs resolved, which shows the trend in volume of open status, but not the net volume of open status bugs chronologically.

This is critical to demonstrate whether a particular release is converging on zero open bugs.
fields.summary: Report: Open bug count history (chronology)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63773].
  {panel}

We've recently introduced a transition condition that ensures an issue cannot be resolved if it has an open review.

This often causes confusion because an issue with an open review does not provide any information as to why the resolve button is missing (or the drop target on an agile board). This means users are often confused as to why the button isn't present.

It would be very useful if the button were to be visible but greyed out in some way, with additional details on hover (for example) to describe what conditions are not met so a user can see what they need to do before they can advance in the workflow.

On an agile board, the drop target could be shown in a different colour for a transition with an unmet condition, and a dialogue explaining the unmet condition could show when a user attempts to drag an issue to a drop target.

Permission based conditions could probably be exempt from this, as it may lead to more confusion. Alternatively, an administrator could be given an option when adding a workflow condition to show the transition in a disabled state with a reason rather than hiding the transition completly.
fields.summary: Improve visibility of transition conditions that are not met

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63770].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When manually installing an application in a JIRA Core instance through the *Versions & licenses* page, if you choose to upload an application that it is not compatible with the current JIRA Core version, no warnings are displayed to the user. The installation will proceed nroamlly, and when concluded a notification will be displayed that JIRA Core must be updated to match the new application's version.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have JIRA check if the new application is compatible before the installation, and if it is not, display a warning to the admin notifing him of this.

h3. Why this is important
If an admin mistankingly uploads a .obr file for a application not compatible with the current JIRA Core version, this will make it so that application stops functioning. A warming beforehand would prevent this from happening. Also, blocking the installation of non compatible applications may also be an option.
fields.summary: Notify that the application is not compatible before its installation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63750].
  {panel}

TC39 (the group responsible for adding features to JavaScript / ECMAScript) have a proposal to introduce a new {{global}} variable: [https://github.com/tc39/proposal-global]

This proposal is now at the Stage 3 (candidate) phase, and Firefox recently tried enabling it in a nightly build. Unfortunately they had to turn it off again after discovering compatibility problems with some well-known sites/software, including JIRA. The problem comes down to JIRA using an old version of moment.js.

Upgrading moment.js to at least version 2.9.0 (which contains [the fix|https://github.com/moment/moment/commit/1601cb1dd7b14277ba8b00cb2ece3ce637923080]) should alleviate any future problems with this proposal.

See [https://github.com/tc39/proposal-global/issues/20#issuecomment-271646615] and [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1328218#c4] for more context.

*Update:* JIRA is also now failing in the newly-released [Safari Technology Preview 21|https://webkit.org/blog/7265/release-notes-for-safari-technology-preview-21/] due to this problem.
fields.summary: Upgrade moment.js to avoid future browser compatibility issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63747].
  {panel}

h3. *Description*
CSV Export for “Select List (multiple choices)” fields, is very unfriendly compared with prior Export to Excel

I can’t say the CSV is actually wrong, since it may be syntactically correct per CSV file format.  BUT, I consider this is a significant degradation compared with the prior direct Export to Excel, because the prior version was much easier to use the resulting Excel file.

h3. *How to replicate*
 * Create “Test-Field” of type “Select List (multiple choices)”
 ** Set 4 options for the field: “option1”, “option2”, “option3”, “option4”
 * Create a ticket and set “Test-field” with the following options
 ** “option1”, “option2”, “option3”
 * Run a filter with the ticket and show field “Test-Field”
 ** Export / “CSV (Current fields)”
 ** Open directly in Excel (or view the CSV as well)

h3. *Result in Excel*
 * The 3 options for this ticket are each in their own Excel column as if they are totally separate data fields
 ** Row 1 (field names) will have the same field name repeated
 *** Cells A1, B1, C1 will all be = “Custom field (Test-Field)”
 ** Row 2 (Data) will have the 3 options
 *** Cell A2 = option1, B2 = option2, C2 = option3
 ** Note – If there were 4 options selected for this field, then there would be 4 columns of data
 ** So the amount of columns used is variable based on the maximum number needed for the ticket with the most selections
 *** For example, say my filter has 100 records
 *** Most records have 3 options selected, but one of them has 10 options selected
 *** 10 columns will be created for this field, but unused for most of the records

h3. *Expected results* (based on prior Export to Excel option in previous JIRA)
 * 1 column with all the options, each separated by a comma
 * No change in number of columns regardless of how many options selected for this field
 * Row 1 (field names)
 ** Cells A1 = “Test-Field”
 * Row 2 (Data)
 ** Cell A2 = “option1, option2, option3”

h3. *Why is this a problem*
 * We use filter with a large number of records, columns and do analysis, tables, charts etc in Excel
 * When reviewing, this forces much scrolling left to right to find the actual data, because many of our multiple choice columns may have up to 10 values used
 * Some of our work in Excel is automated and based on where a column of data is expected

Note – this is using Excel 2016 (Office 365 ProPlus)
fields.summary: Possibility to export multi-select fields of issue into single column in CSV

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63742].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63742]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*

During the database configuration setup, if the user configured JIRA to use a database user with Default Database configured on MSSQL server, JIRA will not know that on the MSSQL server side, it's actually using the Default Database of the user.

For example:
 # JIRA DB configuration:
 ** {{<url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://10.60.3.37:1433;instance=SQLEXPRESS/MOG</url>}}.
 ** {{<username>moga</username>}}.
 # In the SQL Server, I do not have any MOG database.
 # In the SQL Server also, I have set the DB user {{moga}} configured {{MOGA1}} as the Default Database.
 # During the installation, JIRA did not complain that the database does not exist.
 # After setting up JIRA, the MOGA1 database which was empty, now it has all the JIRA tables and data.

Which means, despite the database does not exist, JIRA will use the DB user's Default Database even though in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is pointing to another database.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

*Documentation update:*

By default, the Default Database for DB users will be {{master}}. The documentation on Connecting JIRA to SQL Server will need an update to highlight that users should not alter the Default Database value for any DB users.
fields.summary: Documentation update on SQL Server connection

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. *Problem Definition*

During the database configuration setup, if the user configured JIRA to use a database user with Default Database configured on MSSQL server, JIRA will not know that on the MSSQL server side, it's actually using the Default Database of the user.

For example:
 # JIRA DB configuration:
 ** {{<url>jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://10.60.3.37:1433;instance=SQLEXPRESS/MOG</url>}}.
 ** {{<username>moga</username>}}.
 # In the SQL Server, I do not have any MOG database.
 # In the SQL Server also, I have set the DB user {{moga}} configured {{MOGA1}} as the Default Database.
 # During the installation, JIRA did not complain that the database does not exist.
 # After setting up JIRA, the MOGA1 database which was empty, now it has all the JIRA tables and data.

Which means, despite the database does not exist, JIRA will use the DB user's Default Database even though in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file is pointing to another database.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

*Enhancement on JIRA:*

Check if the DB user has any Default Database configured in MSSQL Server. If it is anything other than {{master}} throw a warning to say that this is not a recommended configuration.
fields.summary: JIRA is using the DB user's default database

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

The endpoints /rest/api/2/group and /rest/api/2/group/members are not case sensitive, while /rest/api/2/group/user is. 

GETting https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test  or https://zaansmeisje.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=TesT returns the same results.



h3. Environment
JIRA 1000.670.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group named TesT using the rest api
 # GET the group details and members by calling below endpoints, see that all of them works fine:
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=TesT
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=Test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group/members?groupname=test
 #- https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group/members?groupname=tESt
 # Now try to add or remove a user to the group without paying attention to the cases (e.g. using endpoint https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/group?groupname=test)

h3. Expected Results
The user is added or removed to/from the group

h3. Actual Results
You get the below error message:
{noformat}
{
  "errorMessages": [
    "You cannot add users to groups which are not visible to you."
  ],
  "errors": {}
}  
{noformat}


h3. Notes
Adding the group TesT or test through the UI creates the same group (and it doesn't warn you that a group with the same name already exists).
(Optional - If Necessary)


h3. Workaround
Use case sensitive names.
fields.summary: The REST API endpoints /rest/api/2/group and /rest/api/2/group/members are not case sensitive, while /rest/api/2/group/user is case sensitive

h3. Summary

Users in JIRA are not notified of issues or comments created via email, even if they should. Same users are notified of issues or comments to issues if they are created in UI. We've been able to replicate this consistently in clean instances.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud, version: 1000.656.2 (not available in Affects Version/s field)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket via email using User A (with access) - make sure User B is notified for 'Issue Created'
 # Add User B as watcher to the ticket - make sure that watcher are notified for 'Comment created'
 ** This is an example, we could also replicate this by assigning the ticket to User B, instead
 # Add a comment to the ticket via UI (comment 1)
 # As User A send a comment to this ticket via email (comment 2). You can use the notification from comment 1.

h3. Expected Results

User B is notified for issue creation and both comment 1 and comment 2.
h3. Actual Results

User B is only notified on comment 1.
h3. Notes

This is very similar to this bug:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63582

However, that one is for JIRA Server and for Outlook, so I'm not sure if they are related.
h3. Workaround

From [~jtillett916844748]:

{quote}
a workaround would be to create a filter to look at issues created in the past 15 minutes and create a subscription to fire every 15 minutes. Dirty, but it's something. 
{quote}

Original comment [HERE|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-63694?focusedCommentId=1006194&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1006194]
fields.summary: Users are not notified of issues/comments created via Email

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63693].
  {panel}

As a JIRA admin, I'd like to know how JIRA is dealing with the attachment structure when creating the subfolders inside the attachment directory.

For example:
 Let's say that your TEST project has the last issue key *TEST-4321*.

 The directory id created by JIRA will be *10000* until the issue key *TEST-10001* is created so JIRA will create the new directory id *20000*.
 
To fix this basically, we'll have to check for each project that has an issue key above 10001 like below:
||Directory id||10000||20000||30000||40000||50000||
||Issue key|1 ~ 10.000|10.001 ~ 20.000|20.001 ~ 30.000|30.001 ~ 40.000|40.001 ~ 50.000|


We found this external article with great informations about this: [Handling millions of attachments in JIRA|http://blog.valiantys.com/en/jira-en/million-jira-issues].
fields.summary: Attachment Directory ID

  {panel}

h3. +Improvement 1+

Can a link to our documentation for setting up the LDAP directory and SSL be added to a section of the JIRA installation guide?

This would be useful in scenarios where the customers need all of these features in their JIRA installation rather than having to search for these documentation after they have completed the installation of JIRA.

h3. +Improvement 2+

Also, can a step by step guide for installing JAVA or a link to our official or 3rd party one be added into the *_Tell me more_* section of the *_Before your Begin_*?

h3. +Reason+

The above would be very useful if the users are installing JIRA for the first time and it would make finding the official documentation needed much easier.

+Affects+

The suggestion is related to this [our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/installing-jira-applications-on-linux-802592173.html].
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Installation Guide

Hello team,

We have our current version of JIRA 6.4 installed on RHEL 5.2 Tikanga. We are planning to upgrade our JIRA environment from 6.4 to 7.2 version and the OS from RHEL 5.2 to RHEL 7.3. We have the below queries:

b. Is JIRA 7.2 compatible on RHEL 7.3 ?

Please let us know if there are any specific issues which you would like us to take care  of while doing the upgrade.

Thanks and Regards,
Kaushik Kakkad.

+91-9922999336

BMC Software

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63686].
  {panel}

I followed a link to an issue which had a trailing comma after the issue key in the URL. It displayed with no indication that there was a problem. On trying to add a comment, I got the Communications Breakdown error ("The JIRA server could not be contacted.").

While this is clearly an edge case, it happened on a link that was detected in text, with the following comma being included in the URL.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Open a issue and add "," (comma) to the end of the url. This could happen when user click on a link in a chatroom.
2. Add a comment to the issue.

*Expected Result:*
Some earlier indication that there's a problem, or for all operations to work. An upfront 404, redirection to the correct URL or for commenting to work.

*Actual Result:*
Got the Communications Breakdown error ("The JIRA server could not be contacted.").
fields.summary: Unable to comment on issue when URL includes extraneous comma

h3. Problem Definition
Customers utilizing Gadgets which rely on multiple field ordering cannot be re-sorted through the UI to match the original filter.  (ex: PROJECT = TEST ORDER BY Priority, CreatedDate ASC).  It is also not possible to reset the gadget back to its original filter (see: JRA-46043)

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option which prevents certain users the ability to sort Gadgets
 
h3. Workaround 
Dashboard Owner can delete and recreate the Gadget so that it adheres to the sort in the Filter

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63668].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior

JIRA 7.2.7 as well as 7.3.0-RC02 include version 2.1.19 of the [JIRA Instance Health Plugin |https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/server/overview]
 * jira-healthcheck-plugin-2.1.19.jar

Version 2.1.19 is impacted by --JRA-61781--. This is fixed in 2.1.20.
h3. Suggested Behavior

Update bundled plugins so that JIRA includes version 2.1.20 or newer
h3. Workaround

The 2.1.20 can be downloaded from the [Version History |https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/versions] and installed using the Manage Add-ons page in JIRA Administration.
h3. Additional Details
 * 2.1.19 is not currently in Atlassian Marketplace. UPM will not prompt user to upgrade.
 ** https://servicedog.atlassian.net/browse/SHC-1048
 * 2.1.19 is bundled with 7.3 but states versions 7.2.0-7.2.7
 * 2.1.20 states compatible with versions 7.2.0-7.2.7
fields.summary: Update bundled JIRA Instance Health Plugin to 2.1.20 or newer

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, the attachment and comment are both separate. Meaning that, you will have to attach the image to the issue first and then only link it in the comment.

h3. Suggested Solution

The users would like to have an option to directly paste the attachment in the comment rather than pasting it in the issue first then linking it in the comment.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63660].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

Users would like to have columns showing the date a project and users were created in their JIRA instance(directly from the JIRA UI) due to Governmental requirement to have data stored for 10 years.

+Expected Behavior+

The creation date of projects would appear on the {{Admin > Project}} page  and something similar should appear in the {{Admin > User Management}} page to allow administrators know the exact date a project or user was created in JIRA directly from the UI.

+Actual+

At the moment, the user would need to dig this information from their JIRA database as we do not feature it within our JIRA UI.
fields.summary: Add Project and User Creation Dates to JIRA UI

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63659].
  {panel}

+Suggestion Summary+

The JIRA System Info page contains a lot of information that is useful to the Admin and Management of a team.

Hence would it be possible to add a feature that allows the automatic exporting of this data to excel or a similar format to aid with reporting in general?

+Expected Behavior+

Administrators are able to have a report of the system information page generated.

+Actual Behavior+

Such a feature does not exist with the best option being to manually print the page using {{Control+P}} and save as pdf.

This can then be distributed.

h3. Problem Definition
Issue search dialog for the *Issue Link* functionality only shows 10 issues.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement customization options to allow more issues to be returned from the search, as well as being able to paginate between them, just like the *View issues screen* behaves today.

h3. Why this is important
On instances with a large number of issues it is difficult to find an issue from this dialog since you can view only 10 results for each search attempt.


h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Allow more than 10 issues to be displayed on the search dialog from the Link Issue dialog

h3. Summary

Asana has an user's mention feature similar to what JIRA have. When importing data from Asana using JIM, this mentions will appear as links to the Asana user profiles.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.2.0
Asana Importers Plugin for JIM 1.0.5 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Import data from Asana using the *External system import* feature
Among the data from Asana you must have descriptions or comments that use the user's mention feature in Asana

h3. Expected Results
The Asana user's mentions in descriptions and comments will appear in JIRA showing the user name as plain text or, ideally, using JIRA mention feature

h3. Actual Results
The mention will appear as a link to the profile of the user in Asana:

In Asana:
!inasana.png|thumbnail!

Imported in JIRA:
!injira.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Asana mentions in description/comments will be imported as links to Asana profiles

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63649].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*

When an issue is closed, users cannot vote for it despite the jira.issue.editable property is set to true or absent.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a Ticket
# Log in as a different user
# Close the issue
# Attempt to vote for the issue

h3. *Expected Behaviour*
 
 User is able to vote.

h3. *Actual Behaviour*

User is unable to vote as the votes link is greyed out. 

h3. *Workaround*

# Reopen the ticket
# Vote for it
# Close the ticket
fields.summary: Allow voting for Closed Issues
